intro: Gnaphalium polycephalum, commonly known as the many-headed everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, fluffy white flowers that are often used in floral arrangements due to their delicate appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in grasslands and open woodlands. Gnaphalium polycephalum is also noted for its aromatic foliage, which emits a subtle, pleasant scent.
